definitions.definition: An area of ground that tends evenly upward or downward.
definitions.example: I had to climb a small slope to get to the site.

definitions.definition: The degree to which a surface tends upward or downward.
definitions.example: The road has a very sharp downward slope at that point.

definitions.definition: The ratio of the vertical and horizontal distances between two points on a line; zero if the line is horizontal, undefined if it is vertical.
definitions.example: The slope of this line is 0.5

definitions.definition: The slope of the line tangent to a curve at a given point.
definitions.example: The slope of a parabola increases linearly with x.

definitions.definition: The angle a roof surface makes with the horizontal, expressed as a ratio of the units of vertical rise to the units of horizontal length (sometimes referred to as run).
definitions.example: The slope of an asphalt shingle roof system should be 4:12 or greater.

definitions.definition: A person of Chinese or other East Asian descent.
To tend steadily upward or downward.
definitions.example: The road slopes sharply down at that point.

definitions.definition: To form with a slope; to give an oblique or slanting direction to; to incline or slant.
definitions.example: to slope the ground in a garden;   to slope a piece of cloth in cutting a garment

definitions.definition: (usually followed by a preposition) To try to move surreptitiously.
definitions.example: I sloped in through the back door, hoping my boss wouldn't see me.

definitions.definition: To hold a rifle at a slope with forearm perpendicular to the body in front holding the butt, the rifle resting on the shoulder.
definitions.example: The order was given to "slope arms".
